text:
I have installed jdk1.5.0_05 and Ant 1.6.5.
Java in default directory C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_05 and Ant in
C:\Program Files\apache-ant-1.6.5.

Problems occurs in Windows CMD shell (but not in Cygwin bash shell) and when
starting ant job from batch file (.bat) from windows CMD and cygwin too.

After setting ANT_PATH from 'C:\Program Files\apache-ant-1.6.5' to
'C:\Progra~1\apache-ant-1.6.5' problems disappeared.
creator: libor_ml1@mts.cz

text: Hmm... what is ANT_PATH? Do you mean ANT_HOME?
creator: mbenson@apache.org

text:
(In reply to comment #2)
> additionally, I cannot reproduce this.

assuming you meant ANT_HOME, that is.
creator: mbenson@apache.org
libor_ml1@mts.cz
text: Oh, I am sorry. Yes, the environment variable I mentioned was ANT_HOME.

creator: mbenson@apache.org
text:
so what happens when you do the following from a CMD prompt?:

SET ANT_HOME=C:\Program Files\apache-ant-1.6.5
PATH=%ANT_HOME%\bin;%PATH%
ant -version

Hmm, it works fine. It seems that problem was at another place. The problem
occurs if the ANT_HOME ends with backslash:
set ANT_HOME=C:\Program Files\apache-ant-1.6.5\

I am not so experienced Windows user (I am a Linux guy) than I do not know if it
is normal that paths must not ends with "path delimiter" or not.
creator: libor_ml1@mts.cz
